title: Radipole Lake Walking Route

images.title: Becky Williamson / Radipole Lake from Radipole Lake Drive, Weymouth
images.caption: Radipole Lake

images.title: David Roberts / Radipole Lake Visitor Centre
images.caption: Visitor Centre. A variety of wildlife-related merchandise is available here along with light refreshments. A list of birds seen at the reserve on the day is also provided, with a view over part of the lake where wildfowl can be seen.

images.title: David Roberts / Radipole Watercourse
images.caption: A watercourse among the flowers and reeds looking towards shops and superstores. Keywords: fence, flowers, flora, grass, reeds, reedbeds, reed beds

images.title: David Roberts / Radipole Flora
images.caption: Flowers including willowherb, foxgloves and valerian growing by the lake

images.title: Waterbirds, Radipole Lake Nature Reserve, Weymouth by Brian Robert Marshall, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Waterbirds and the backdrop of the local hills.

images.title: Footpath, Radipole Lake Nature Reserve, Weymouth by Brian Robert Marshall, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: One of the footpaths

images.title: Roger Cornfoot / Tufted Duck, at RSPB Radipole Lakes
images.caption: Tufted Duck

images.title: Roger Cornfoot / Footbridge, at the entrance to Radipole Lakes RSPB Reserve
images.caption: Footbridge, at the entrance to Radipole Lakes RSPB Reserve

description:
This walk visits the RSPB's Radipole Lake Nature Reserve in Weymouth The reserve is located on the River Wey and includes some pleasant footpaths taking you around the large lake where you can look out for a wide variety of wildlife. Keep your eyes peeled for bearded tits, kingfishers,otters and water voles.  
The Rodwell Trail starts from the reserve. You could continue your walking along this shared cycling and walking trail. It will take you to the historic Sandsfoot Castle and Gardens which is another local highlight. Lodmoor Country Park is located just a mile to the east. There's another wildlife rich nature reserve here with good facilities and a cycle path.
